articles.summary: Bitcoin (BTC) breached $126,100 for the first time in history on Oct. 6, climbing 2.5% in 24 hours. Bitcoin has since retraced to $123,500 and is now sitting around the previous all-time high.

articles.title: Treasury defends lawfulness of minting a $1 Trump coin
articles.author: system
articles.summary: 2020 collectible coinage law allows a living person to appear on U.S. currency, according to the Treasury Department. The law applies only to people who are alive and living in the United States at the time of the law's adoption.

articles.title: Bybit CEO outlines real-world blockchain applications transforming finance

He urged the industry to move beyond speculation toward tangible use cases built on the blockchain infrastructure. He believes there is a fundamental shift in how money moves across the world.

articles.title: BlackRock Bitcoin ETF emerges as the most profitable, surpassing legacy funds
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) has become the firm's most profitable fund, generating $244.5 million annually and nearing $100 billion in assets. IIT surpassed legacy ETFs that took decades to reach similar levels. Analysts highlight IIT's rapid rise as proof of strong investor demand.

articles.title: Bitcoin Miners Posted Record Profits in 2Q as HPC Push Accelerated, JPMorgan Says
articles.author: Coin Desk
articles.summary: JPMorgan says the second quarter and summer of 2025 were transformative for bitcoin miners. There was record cash operating profits and a pivot toward high-performance computing (HPC) Cipher Mining's (CIFR) 244 megawatt colocation deal with Fluidstack and IREN's (IREN) expansion to HPC.

This is mainly driven by a surge in institutional interest and the transformative power of blockchain technology. The next step going forward will be the tokenization of financial assets.
